page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area covers the north western suburbs of Doncaster, South Yorkshire.It includes four communities {Woodlands,Highfields,Scawthorpe and {Scawsby.}The first two villages were built to house miners who worked at { {Brodsworth Colliery}and their families. Significant features include the { {A1(M) motorway}which is a national North/South route and the {A638(T) } which was part of the{Great North {Road.} Archaeological features include the {Roman Ridge}footpath,the remains of a{ {Motte and Bailey Castle,}and the medieval{Radcliffe Moat}manor house. { }In spite of the strong industrial and urban connections, over a third of the area is given over to agriculture with farms at{Scawsby Hall, Highfields and{Adwick Grange.
